artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kobayashi Tetsujirō; Carver: Muneoka Nobukichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 460.1; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 278.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; man riding a white and grey horse, seen from back, with blood on man's arms and horse's hips and PL back leg; arrow in horse's PR flank; fallen figure with two arrows in chest, bleeding, in LLQ; another figure standing in front of horse, with only bloody face and bloody PR leg visible; stream in middle ground; green mountains in background
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 彫工宗岡 {horikō Muneoka}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Yoshitoshi's Unsurpassed Warriors (Yoshitoshi musha burui 芳年武者旡類)
title: Hatakeyama Shōji Shigetada
